itemDescription: British military personnel; High Sheriff of Durham (1894-1981)

wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Robert Appleby Bartram, MC, TD, DL (2 April 1894 – 1 June 1981) was a British soldier and shipbuilder.

response: George Bartram and John Lister founded the business in Hylton in 1837–38. In 1852–54 their partnership was dissolved and Bartram's son Robert Appleby Bartram was taken into the business.

In 1889 Haswell retired, Robert Appleby Bartram's sons, George and William, joined the firm and the name was changed to Bartram & Sons. Between 1902 and 1914 it built 10 cargo liners for Ben Line. In 1914 it employed 600 people.
In 1922 the firm became a limited company. George's sons, Robert Appleby Bartram and George Hylton Bartram took over in 1925. From 1921 to 1930 Bartram's built at least 17 tramp steamers.
*1950: Lt Col. Robert Appleby Bartram of Broomshiels Hall, near Bishop Auckland

link_mentions.page: List of deputy lieutenants of Durham
response: *11 February 1956: Hon. Col. Robert Appleby Bartram
Robert Appleby Bartram may refer to:
*Robert Appleby Bartram (British Army officer) (1894–1981), shipbuilder, British Army officer and namesake grandson of the above
Sir Robert Appleby Bartram, JP (23 March 1835 – 8 August 1925) was a British shipbuilder.
Bartram died in Harrogate, North Riding of Yorkshire, in 1925 and was buried in Bishopwearmouth Cemetery, Sunderland, on 11 August 1925. His namesake grandson was Colonel Robert Appleby Bartram.
